page.title: 07FORMAKIN HOUSE
page.content: One of the oldest-looking houses in the district is in fact among the youngest. Formakin with its Lodge House, the "Monkey House" (so-called because of the stone monkeys adorning the roof-line), and its entrance gate thought to be originally from Newgate Prison, was completed in 1914 by Sir Robert Lorimer for John Augustus Holmes of Glasgow. The main building was never inhabited and was built mainly to house the owner's considerable collection of objets d'art. The gardens were open to the public in the 1930's, but the owner was bankrupted in the difficult years of the late 1930's, and the estate sold to A.E.Pickard in 1940 for just Â£7000. The house and grounds are now being restored by the Formakin Trust and will shortly be open to the public.
